edge: Mephistopheles sends his bounty hunter, the Ghost Rider, to retrieve the contract of San Venganza for control of a thousand dark souls.
Ghost Rider refuses to retrieve the contract of San Venganza, as he believes it would give Mephistopheles too much power.
Mephistopheles offers to cure Johnny's father's cancer in exchange for his soul.
Johnny runs into his former sweetheart Roxanne after becoming a famous motorcycle stuntman.
Blackheart seeks aid from the Hidden to find the lost contract of San Venganza.
Ghost Rider kills earth angel Gressil while transformed into his fiery form.

node_1: his flesh burning off his skeleton
edge: Johnny Blaze transforms into Ghost Rider due to a curse, causing his body to burn and flesh to fall off his skeleton.
Ghost Rider kills the earth angel Gressil as part of his supernatural abilities and duties as a vengeful spirit.
The Penance Stare, a power possessed by Ghost Rider, causes street thugs to feel the pain they have inflicted on others, searing their soul.
The Caretaker reveals to Ghost Rider that what happened to him is real and will continue to happen as he comes across evil souls at night.
Ghost Rider reveals his true identity as the Devil's bounty hunter to Roxanne, but she is initially unconvinced.
Blackheart kills Johnny Blaze's friend Mack and takes Roxanne hostage, demanding that Ghost Rider retrieve the contract of San Venganza.
Ghost Rider tries to use the Penance Stare on Blackheart, but it proves ineffective as Blackheart has no soul.
The Caretaker reveals to Ghost Rider that the contract of San Venganza is hidden inside a spade and urges him to retrieve it to save Roxanne.
The Caretaker informs Ghost Rider that the contract of San Venganza holds significant value and is hidden inside a spade.

Legion attempts to finish Johnny off by absorbing the thousand souls, but is distracted when Roxanne uses Johnny's shotgun to separate them. Johnny shoots Legion with the gun, holding it in the shadows to allow him to enhance it with his power. Keeping his own body in shadow, he transforms again and uses his Penance Stare to render Legion catatonic by burning all the corrupt souls within him.

The Caretaker reveals that the contract is hidden inside a spade and gives it to Johnny. The Caretaker then transforms with Blaze, revealing that he is actually Carter Slade. After killing the water angel Wallow, Johnny gives Blackheart the contract.

Demanding the contract to save Roxanne. The Caretaker reveals that it is hidden inside a spade, telling Johnny that he is stronger than his predecessors because he sold his soul for love rather than greed.

Mephistopheles appears and declares the contract is complete, offering to take back the curse of the Ghost Rider. Determined not to let anyone else make another deal, Johnny declines, declaring that he will use his power against the demon and against all harm that comes to the innocent.
Johnny Blaze, also known as Ghost Rider, is preparing for his new life after being given a second chance.
Infuriated by an unknown event, Mephistopheles vows to make Ghost Rider pay and disappears with Blackheart's body.
Ghost Rider is determined to protect the innocent from harm.
After being given a second chance, Johnny kisses Roxanne and prepares for his new life as Ghost Rider with her support.
